info: The ACOE strives to empower OPS staff to create accessible digital products by providing trusted expertise, how-to advice, resources, and leadership in an evolving digital I&IT environment. explication: Assistance for Children with Severe Disabilities

At the corporate level, this team is responsible for facilitating enterprise architecture to ensure that the architecture meets business needs by creating, maintaining content and frameworks, leveraging cluster work, resolving architectural issues, reviewing architectural projects and providing recommendations to ARB.

Administrative Drivers Licence Suspension (ADLS) system manages the road side licence suspension program for impaired drivers & retrieves & updates driver info from the driver system. Associate deputy ministers are deputy ministers in waiting, often assigned to lead major ministry divisions or initiatives. Assistant Deputy Ministers report to a Deputy Minister.
Administrative office of an assistant deputy minister (any ministry).

The Accident Data System (ADS) is the mainframe precursor (built in 1987) to COLNET (built in 2000). Collision data is entered through COLNET and is later synchronized to ADS (VSAM data store). ADS collision data is a key input into the ORSAR report.
The mandate of the ADSC Committee is to eliminate barriers to full workplace participation for all Youth Justice Division staff, through the promotion of positive and supportive measures.

Airport Ground Transportation Association (AGTA) is a trade association for ground transportation operators, airport authorities, and industry suppliers dedicated to the continuous improvement of airport ground transportation services for the traveling public.

explication: Association of Law Officers of the Crown

API is the acronym for Application Programming Interface, which is a software intermediary that allows two applications to talk to each other.

Corporate board that provides operational level Enterprise Architecture approval for the Information and Information Technology Organization. The corporate ARB is an integral part of the OPS Enterprise Architecture governance body responsible for ensuring compliance and assuring quality.

Program is granted to individuals whom have a reasonable and lawful use of the information. The MTO records can be accessed by a variety of organizations for legitimate MTO authorized uses under the AR program

This Regulation establishes accessibility standards for customer service and it applies to every designated public sector organization and to every other person or organization that provides goods or services to members of the public or other third parties and that has at least one employee in Ontario.

A Ministry of Transportation (MTO), Corporate Services Division Branch responsible for providing high quality, cost-effective business support services that help MTO deliver their priority transportation initiatives.

The Cabinet Office provides the Premier and their Cabinet with advice and analysis to help the government achieve its priorities.

A change request is a formal proposal that can be submitted by a stakeholder in the organization or by a service user via the service desk, utilizing the request fulfillment process to alter a configuration item.

Ontario's Vehicle Impoundment Program is utilized by the Ministry of Transportation to record commerical vehicle impounds. The progtrams are aimed at making our roads safer, swiftly removing suspended drivers off Ontario roads saves lives.

An inspection report completed by an enforcement officer or police officer of a complete mechanical inspection of a commercial vehicle. This inspection usually takes place on a road, at a truck inspection station or at the carrier’s place of business. Safety defects, if any, are included in this report.

Commercial vehicle operators in Ontario must have a valid Commercial Vehicle Operator's Registration (CVOR) certificate and carry a copy. The CVOR system monitors commercial carrier safety to improve road safety for all road users.

Digital Asset Consumers (DAC) act as data consumers that request Digital Assets from users, and once the user consent is recorded, collect the Digital Asset data related to the user from the service Ledger Network.

Digital Asset Providers (DAP) act as data sources for the Network, providing user data through Digital Assets and allowing a user to share their account related information from multiple sources in one authentication and licensing/consent action.

The Driver Certification Program (DCP) is a voluntary program which gives organizations the authority from the Ministry of Transportation (MTO) to train and test their employees/students for the purpose of upgrading or renewing classified licences, class M and/or endorsements.

The Digital Drivers Handbook is a new business model initiative for the Ministry of Transportation official drivers handbook. The new business model includes developing a digital version of all available handbooks with the aim of reducing print volumnes and determining if all publishing services can be conducted in-house as well as ensuring a sustainable funding model.

Digital Garage's Digital Data Inights service is focused on enabling the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development (MLTSD) and Ministry of Transportation (MTO) to draw valuable business insights from internal and external data leveraging data science, visualizations, self-serve analytics and artificial intelligence.

The Digital Document Management (DDM) product is part of Road User Safety Transformation modernization 2.1 program. The goal of this project is to modernize MTO document collection through a fully digital document management solution providing efficient capture and rapid retrieval, while also transforming policy to move from paper-based to digital process output.

This service is responsible for providing knowledge and driving tests to individuals applying for or renewing Ontario driver's licenses in any class, including commercial classes of licences. The service also maintains and operates a network of Drive Test facilities and Travel Point facilities (part-time locations) which respond to customer inquiries and complaints.
The Digital First Assessment is process to assess whether services are meeting the Digital Service Standard.

The Digital Garage's mandate is to explore creative ideas, emerging technologies, and implement digital soutions to solve problems. Our goal is to deliver digital services built around user needs that are simple and easy to use.

The Driver Instructor Card Elimination (DICE) initiative was a joint engagement between Road User Safety (RUS) Program Development and Evaluation Branch and the LTC Digital Garage to evaluate the future of the physical Driving Instructor Licence Card (DILC) and identify opportunities to move in a more digital direction.​

Data Information Management Analytics (DIMA) product is part of Road User Safety Transformation modernization 2.1 program. The Driver Medical Review (DMR) product is part of Road User Safety Transformation modernization 2.1 program. Physicians, nurse practitioners and optometrists must report to the MTO when patients have medical or vision conditions that make driving a higher risk.

The Information Management Leadership Committee (IMLC) coordinates the delivery of information management services to client ministries to support program areas in meeting the government’s business objectives.

The Information, Privacy and Archives (IPA) division provides leadership in support of effective recordkeeping, access and privacy practices across the Ontario Public Service (OPS) and designated agencies.

Manages the registration of Ontario-based commercial carriers and fleets of vehicles for inter-jurisdictional travel through Canada and the United States. The system calculates, collects and disburses fees and taxes, based on each jurisdictions fee table, and the fees are apportioned, based on the mileage traveled in the jurisdiction.

A Transportation Safety Division (TSD) system which delivers secure access to driver, vehicle, & carrier information in support of the core business of other Ministries, Agencies, & enforcement jurisdictions across municipal, provincial, & federal borders.

A procurement document that requests a response from potential vendors to supply goods or services to meet government business need(s). The RFB may include specific requirements, terms and conditions.

The request for proposal (RFP) is a common business tool used by the Ontario Government to find the best vendor while maximizing value and minimizing risk.

explication: Registration and Licensing System of Ontario
info: The Ministry of Transportation Ontario (MTO), along with Infosys Public Services (IPS), has implemented a new customer-centric carrier registration, licensing and performance monitoring system as part of its Road User Safety Modernization program. This new Registration and Licensing System of Ontario (RLSO) is a modernization of the MTO’s previous 40-year-old system, digitizing service delivery for thousands of carriers and businesses.

Revenue Management (RM) product is part of Road User Safety Transformation modernization 2.1 program. The goal of this project is to modernize RUS financial operations by implementing a modern accounting solution that provides timely revenue recognition, flexible reporting, and product-based pricing with a restructured general ledger.

Road User Safety is undertaking a multi-year strategy to transform the way the MTO and its partner ministries deliver services to Ontarians. The ministry uses a hybrid model to deliver its programs through a mix of government delivery of core programs, and utilizing third-party vendors to deliver driver examination, card production and driver and vehicle registration services. The transformation seeks to overcome the unique challenges of delivering services in the modern age using business processes and technologies that are decades old

The Social Assistance Management System (SAMS) stores personal and financial information for all social assistance applicants and recipients of OW, ODSP, and ACSD. This provincial application, and the underlying dataset, is used by Provincial, Municipal and First Nation's staff as a system to assess people's social assistance eligibility and entitlement within Ontario.

A Vendor of Record (VOR) is a procurement arrangement resulting from a fair, open and transparent procurement process that authorizes one or more vendors to offer specific goods or services to ministries for a defined time period; with terms, conditions and pricing as set out in the particular VOR arrangement. It is established through a Request for Proposal (RFP) distributed through an electronic tendering service.

The system functions include the registration of vehicles, plates and registrants; validation sticker issuance & renewal; permits; status changes; own choice or graphic plates order; mailing drive clean and permit renewal invitations.

The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines are typically referred to by their acronym WCAG (pronounced “wick-ag”). It’s a series of guidelines created by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) in order to improve website accessibility.
A collection of online services offer by the Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) to all Ontario workers who sustain an injury or illness happens on the job.
Workforce Information Network (or WIN) is a PeopleSoft self-service application used to manage payroll, benefits and human resources data in the Ontario Public Service (OPS).

The WSIB is an insurance organization which provides wage-loss benefits, medical coverage and support to help people get back to work after a work-related injury or illness. The WSIB is funded by premiums paid by Ontario businesses.
